content: to beginning varying amounts from approximately wind your yarn until you have a few feet left 9 to 30 grams of yarn were joined together and using any joining method you like i prefer the wound into monster yarn cakes to be used for russian join join the next yarn to the yarn end © 2017 jennifer peck all rights reserved 2 pattern for personal use only questions contact websterstreetknittery@gmail com from the winder wind your next yarn after pattern instructions joining >> i-cord cast on continue in this fashion until you have used all your yarns or until your winder cannot hold any using the double pointed needles co 3 sts additional yarn make as many monster yarn cakes as your heart desires this method can also be do not turn work used to wind your yarns into large balls if you do not have access to a winder slide the stitches to the opposite end of the needle and transfer the needle to your left hand working yarn should be at the left most stitch glossary k3 do not turn work bobble bind off co cast on repeat the last two steps until you have an i-cord k knit 241 row long k2tog knit two together m1l make one left transfer the 3 live sts to the circular needles then m1r make one right being careful not to twist the i-cord pick up and rs right side knit 240 sts along the edge of the i-cord sl slip_stitch purlwise ssk slip slip knit the two stitches next pick up and knit 3 sts from the co end together st s stitch es 246 sts ws wrong side wyif with yarn in front >> body of blanket note you may wish to use a removable stitch marker to mark one edge or side of your work to more easily distinguish the rs and ws row 1 ws sl3 wyif k to last 3 sts sl3 wyif row 2 rs k3 *k2tog k7 m1r k2 m1l k7 ssk repeat from * to last 3 sts k3 repeat row 1 and 2 until blanket is desired length ending with a ws row >> i-cord bind off bobble all sts as follows *k2 k2tog tbl return 3 sts to left needle repeat from * until 3 sts remain © 2017 jennifer peck all rights reserved 3 pattern for personal use only questions contact websterstreetknittery@gmail com break yarn leaving several inches of tail pull yarn social media through last 3 sts to secure weave the yarn tail into the i-cord edge to create a smooth unbroken >> follow i-cord @websterstreetknittery on instagram >> tag >> finishing tag your progress and finished blanket
